intro: Trachysciadium, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to regions of Africa, particularly in the eastern and southern parts of the continent. The plants typically grow in rocky or mountainous areas, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. They are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Trachysciadium species are often found in open habitats and are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
